critique: The document is an approval of a Code of Fair Competition for the Furniture Manufacturing Industry under the National Industrial Recovery Act. This act was part of Franklin D. Roosevelt's New Deal program during the Great Depression. The document itself doesn't directly address immigration, executive power, federalism, national security, or social inclusion. However, it heavily involves the government in economic regulation. Given the context of the New Deal, it leans towards liberal ideology due to government intervention in the economy.
